result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia M Garduno

defendant.name: Garduno, Alicia M
defendant.address: 1616 South Marquette Road #22, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with James Stewart.

11:35 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Alicia M Garduno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Alicia M Garduno.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Timothy Warren, probation agent appeared by video

Court - this is set for both Prelim. Hrg. and modification of bond

AS TO PRELIMINARY HEARING:

   Atty Richards states def is waiving preliminary hearing

   Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court 
   accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing.  

   Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Information filed at this time

AS TO BOND MODIFICATION

Atty. Richards is heard on bond modification request
Agt. Warren is heard - def. is eligible to begin Rock County Education and Criminal Addictions Program 
Questions by Court - response by Agt. Warren - must be on signature bond - if on cash bond will not be eligible for that program.

Court modifies bond to $500.00 Signature bond with same non-monetary conditions.  Def. may appear by zoom for hearings for the next 5-6 months, including a Plea/Sentencing.
comments by def - requests court modify this bond just before Nov. 2, so she gets credit on this case or she will be transferred to Dane Co.
Comments by Mr. Warren - if not on cash bond, Crawford Co. jail will likely reach out to have her transferred to Dane Co.

Court declines to stay the change in bond - effective today.

ARRAIGNMENT

Atty Richards waives reading of information, def. enters plea of NOT GUILTY
Court directs clerk to enter plea of NOT GUILTY

Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Steven Richards

11:15 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Alicia M Garduno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards appeared in person for defendant Alicia M Garduno. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:31 PM Defendant Alicia M Garduno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Alicia M Garduno.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard, will be filing a criminal complaint. Asking for another week to file report. 

Defendant is heard. Was offered an ATR and requests a signature bond. 

Court comments.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:26 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Alicia M Garduno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wynes appeared via video for defendant.  

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with James Stewart. 

Attorney Wynes is heard and requests a signature bond. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with James Stewart. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with James Stewart.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
